page.title: 20Brackley local History
page.content: This section relates to page 19 - "Ghost village near Brackley". The following is an excerpt from "History, Topography and Directory of Northamptonshire" by Whellan (published in 1874). "Astwick and Plowman's Furze form the south and west sides of this parish. The former place contains about 670 acres and the latter about 500 acres, the whole belonging to Magdalen College, Oxford. The village of Astwick, now consisting of a few scattered houses, is situated 11/2 miles SW of Evenley. "It appears" says Bridges "to have been formerly a large town, as may be seen from the ruins, which are called the Old Town. There was formerly a manor house, the site of which now is overgrown, but there is still remaining a moat full of water, 150 paces along and 10 yards wide.""
